description:
At Klein, Daday, Aretos & O'Donoghue, LLC, in Lake Geneva, Wisconsin, we are fully committed to delivering the exceptional representation and support you need for all of the important and pressing legal matters affecting your life, your family, your business and your future. To that end, our law firm offers unmatched counsel and advocacy in a variety of practice areas so that you can find solutions for virtually all of your civil, criminal, commercial and family law issues all under one roof.

Along with our Lake Geneva office, we have four other law offices throughout the greater Chicago metro area, and we have achieved this level of success by providing the personalized attention our clients deserve while helping them find the creative, effective and value-based solutions they need for their legal matters involving any of the following:

  • Criminal, felony and traffic defense
  • Family law and divorce
  • Civil litigation
  • Real estate law
  • Condominium and common interest community association law
  • Corporate law
  • Banking and finance
  • Transactional law
  • Estate planning
  • Bankruptcy
  • Appeals
  • Mortgage foreclosure and collections on behalf of lenders

For more than 30 years now, our law firm has become the trusted source for individuals, families, business owners, corporate executives and managers, and others across the region. We have been able to earn our clients' trust by adhering to our core values of integrity, professionalism and responsiveness, and by maintaining a high standard of excellence in everything we do.

Our primary focus is on helping you resolve your issues and obtaining the positive results you expect efficiently, and our attorneys all work together as a team to leverage our respective strengths in order to achieve this goal. To begin the process, you can contact Klein, Daday, Aretos & O'Donoghue, LLC, by calling our law office or visiting our website to schedule a consultation and discover what all we can do for you.

We are a debt relief agency. We help people file for bankruptcy relief under the Bankruptcy Code.
